topic: Forgotten Aztec Gardening Tricks That Make Modern Permaculture Look Complicated

Section1.title: Twilight over Tenochtitlán
Section1.summary: As the sun sets over a sprawling floating city, you glide silently in a canoe, drawn toward the ancient secrets of the Aztec gardens.

Section2.title: Chinampas Take Root
Section2.summary: You witness the miraculous emergence of man-made islands—woven from reeds and mud—as farmers begin to sculpt the lake itself into fertile land.

Section3.title: The Mud Alchemists
Section3.summary: You watch as gardeners stir together lake sediment, ash, and compost, transforming waste into rich, living soil that nourishes everything it touches.

Section4.title: Canals of Quiet Genius
Section4.summary: Moving through the shaded canals, you begin to see how the waterways serve not just as roads, but as irrigation, refrigeration, and lifelines.

Section5.title: Three Sisters and Beyond
Section5.summary: In a patch of garden, you kneel beside corn, beans, and squash—woven together in sacred geometry that feeds families and heals the land.

Section6.title: Hummingbirds in the Milpa
Section6.summary: As hummingbirds dart among the flowers, you learn how polycultures and native pollinators keep this living system perfectly in balance.

Section7.title: Compost Temples
Section7.summary: You pass heaps of decaying matter tended like shrines, and you begin to understand how the Aztecs honored life even in its end.

Section8.title: The Calendar in the Soil
Section8.summary: By moonlight, you trace the gardeners’ planting cycles—mapped not by clocks, but by celestial rhythms and sacred calendars older than memory.

Section9.title: Pest Control by Moon and Mind
Section9.summary: You observe farmers using chili smoke, frog songs, and lunar rituals to ward off pests—methods at once simple and spiritually tuned.

Section10.title: Medicine in the Maize Rows
Section10.summary: Amid the food crops, you find healing herbs—each placed with care, part of a garden that feeds body, spirit, and story.

Section11.title: The Floating Forests
Section11.summary: You drift past towering willows and mesquite trees rooted in chinampas—silent guardians that stabilize soil and summon rain with their shade.

Section12.title: When Water Speaks
Section12.summary: You pause to listen as farmers read ripples, soil moisture, and bird calls, adapting their planting with a grace modern systems struggle to match.

Section13.title: The Empire's Living Pantry
Section13.summary: From cacao to amaranth, you walk through gardens that don’t just feed the city—they store seeds, prayers, and genetic memory.

Section14.title: Collapse and Silence
Section14.summary: You witness the fall—canals choked, gardens drowned in conquest—and feel the hush descend over a civilization's green brilliance.

Section15.title: Roots That Remember
Section15.summary: As dawn breaks over a misty field, you realize the old ways live on—in soil, seeds, and the quiet hands of those who still listen.
